panels.title: Soft min 0, soft max 30, with spike

options.content:
## Soft min and max

Auto **Min** and **Max** can make small variations look much bigger than they  are. This can be fixed by setting **Min** & **Max**. 
This creates a new problem when spikes in the data occur. Because the 
**Min** and **Max** are hard the full spike cannot be seen. 

The new _Time series_ panel has options for **Soft min** and **Soft max** that can solve 
this. With these new options you can control the default range of the axis but also allow going
beyond this range when the data does. 

You can combine both the existing standard option **Min** and **Max** and the new **Soft min**
 and **Soft max** to define both soft and hard limits.

## Multiple Y-Axes

With the new panel you can have more than 2 y-axes! 

You control axis by setting unit. You can create new 
axis by setting unit using an override rule.

## Richer display options

The new time series panel supports more control over lines, fill gradients that 
work for both line, area graphs & bars.

panels.title: Value mappings that work on y-axis

options.content:
## Value mappings

Standard field config value mappings work and will affect the y-axis.

#### Points
- Points enabled
- Mixing in line fill but with line width set to zero
- Gradient area fill

### Stacking

You can enable stacking under Graph styles

#### Mix styles

* You can override and set any display style for a specific series

### Connect null values

With this option you can control if null values
should be rendered as gaps or connected

#### Thresholds
- You can define thresholds in the Grid & Axes tab in edit mode 
- You can define one or two thresholds, color is also changeable. 
- You can have lower bound thresholds as well.

#### Bars
- In display styles tab you can switch from line to bars
- The width of the bar is relative to the pixel width between two values

#### Histogram

This is separate visualization that performs 
a histogram calculation paired with a bar chart.
